summary.p: The Gaṇanighaṇṭu, also known as the Oṣadhinighaṇṭu or the Madanādinighaṇṭu, is a medical lexicon by Candranandana. He is also the author of a commentary on the Aṣṭāṅgahṛdaya which was translated into Tibetan in the 11th century.
Filliozat has misspelled the title of this manuscript as Guṇanighaṇṭu; this is noted in the New Catalogus Catalogorum which gives the correct title (vol. 6, 355).
The microfilm has been ordered back to front.

msItem.incipit:
giriśaṃ girijāṃ devīṃ gaṇeśaṃ haṃsavāhinī gurum ārabhyate natvā lekhyaṃtī ghaṃṭapustakaṃ 1 praṇamya mūrddhā sarva
jñaṃ nighaṃṭur abhidhīyate | caṃdranaṃdanasaṃjñena ravinaṃdanasūtanā 2 aṣṭāṃgahṛdayo kteṣu madanādiṣu vargeṣu [sarveṣu] | dravyeṣu viprakīrṇeṣu tayā saṃjñāṃta
reṣu ca 2 madanaḥ śalyako rāhaḥ piṃḍītaḥ karahāṭakaḥ | gālaḥ phalaṃ gāgalaṃ ca vālaṃ proktaṃ śalāṭu ca 3

supportDesc.foliation: Devanḡarī numerals, top left corner, verso.

additions.desc: Running marginal title, nighaṃṭu, top left margin, verso.
A title card in Cordier's hand gives the title and author in Devanāgarī script, details about the antigraph from Bikaner, and a reference to the Tengyur.

origin.origDate: Colophon is dated to (Vikrama) saṃvat 1957, month of Vaiśākha, corresponding to 1900 CE.

provenance.p: Part of the collection of Palmyr Cordier.
